events.name: Ukraine President fires head of SBU and prosecutor general
events.wd_label: Ukraine President fires head of SBU and prosecutor general
events.wd_description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy abruptly fired the head of Ukraine's domestic security agency, the SBU, and the state prosecutor general due to numerous cases of collaboration with Russia by officials in their agencies.
events.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy abruptly fired the head of Ukraine's domestic security agency, the SBU, and the state prosecutor general due to numerous cases of collaboration with Russia by officials in their agencies.

events.name: sacking of Ivan Bakanov
events.wd_description: SBU chief Ivan Bakanov, Zelenskiy's childhood friend, was abruptly fired.
events.description: SBU chief Ivan Bakanov, Zelenskiy's childhood friend, was abruptly fired.

events.name: sacking of Iryna Venediktova
events.wd_description: Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova, who played a key role in prosecuting Russian war crimes, was also abruptly fired.
events.description: Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova, who played a key role in prosecuting Russian war crimes, was also abruptly fired.

events.name: reasons for the sackings
events.wd_description: Over 60 officials from Bakanov's and Venediktova's agencies have started working against Ukraine in Russian-occupied territories, leading to 651 alleged treason cases and collaborations being opened.
events.description: Over 60 officials from Bakanov's and Venediktova's agencies have started working against Ukraine in Russian-occupied territories, leading to 651 alleged treason cases and collaborations being opened.

events.name: Zelenskiy's statement
events.wd_description: President Zelenskiy stated that the crimes against national security by officials pose serious questions to their leaders and vowed to provide proper answers.
events.description: President Zelenskiy stated that the crimes against national security by officials pose serious questions to their leaders and vowed to provide proper answers.

events.name: Attack on Nigerian prison by Boko Haram
events.wd_label: Attack on Nigerian prison by Boko Haram
events.wd_description: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for an attack on a Nigerian prison where approximately 440 inmates escaped, highlighting the ongoing security challenges in the country.
events.description: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for an attack on a Nigerian prison where approximately 440 inmates escaped, highlighting the ongoing security challenges in the country.

events.name: prison attack
events.wd_description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a medium-security prison to free their members, resulting in one security officer killed and three others injured.
events.description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a medium-security prison to free their members, resulting in one security officer killed and three others injured.

events.name: prison break
events.wd_description: During the attack, 879 inmates fled the facility, with 443 still at large, four inmates dead, and 16 injured.
events.description: During the attack, 879 inmates fled the facility, with 443 still at large, four inmates dead, and 16 injured.

events.name: President Buhari's response
events.wd_description: President Muhammadu Buhari visited the prison, condemned the attack, and questioned the prison's security system while ordering investigations.
events.description: President Muhammadu Buhari visited the prison, condemned the attack, and questioned the prison's security system while ordering investigations.

events.name: separate attack on presidential convoy
events.wd_description: In a separate incident, the convoy of President Buhari was ambushed on his way to Daura for Islamic festivals, further highlighting the security challenges in Nigeria.
events.description: In a separate incident, the convoy of President Buhari was ambushed on his way to Daura for Islamic festivals, further highlighting the security challenges in Nigeria.

events.name: Escalation of tension around Iran-US nuclear talks breakdown
events.wd_label: Escalation of tension around Iran-US nuclear talks breakdown
events.wd_description: Tensions escalated around the breakdown in talks between Iran and the US over Tehran's nuclear program, with warnings from Israel about Iran's capabilities and statements from European nations.
events.description: Tensions escalated around the breakdown in talks between Iran and the US over Tehran's nuclear program, with warnings from Israel about Iran's capabilities and statements from European nations.

events.name: Israel's warning
events.wd_description: Israeli Defense Minister Benny Gantz warned that Iran could produce enough enriched uranium to make three nuclear warheads in a few weeks.
events.description: Israeli Defense Minister Benny Gantz warned that Iran could produce enough enriched uranium to make three nuclear warheads in a few weeks.

events.name: statement by UN nuclear inspectorate chief
events.wd_label: statement by UN nuclear inspectorate chief
events.wd_description: Rafael Grossi, chief of the UN's nuclear inspectorate, stated that restoring the knowledge lost concerning Iran's nuclear activities would be tough, as inspectors and cameras have been barred from key sites by Iran.
events.description: Rafael Grossi, chief of the UN's nuclear inspectorate, stated that restoring the knowledge lost concerning Iran's nuclear activities would be tough, as inspectors and cameras have been barred from key sites by Iran.

events.name: statement by France Germany and the UK
events.wd_label: statement by France Germany and the UK
events.wd_description: France, Germany, and the UK issued a statement saying they could no longer offer concessions in the revival talks and expressed serious doubts about Iran's intentions and commitment to a successful outcome.
events.description: France, Germany, and the UK issued a statement saying they could no longer offer concessions in the revival talks and expressed serious doubts about Iran's intentions and commitment to a successful outcome.

events.name: EV battery supply chain transformation under the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022
events.wd_label: EV battery supply chain transformation under the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022
events.wd_description: The Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 aims to promote US production of electric vehicles, renewable energy technologies, and critical minerals by revising the tax credit for EVs and imposing new sourcing requirements.
events.description: The Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 aims to promote US production of electric vehicles, renewable energy technologies, and critical minerals by revising the tax credit for EVs and imposing new sourcing requirements.

events.name: revised EV tax credit
events.wd_description: The Inflation Reduction Act revises the existing US tax credit of $7,500 for qualifying EVs, eliminating the 200,000 vehicle limit and making substantial changes to eligibility criteria.
events.description: The Inflation Reduction Act revises the existing US tax credit of $7,500 for qualifying EVs, eliminating the 200,000 vehicle limit and making substantial changes to eligibility criteria.

events.name: critical mineral requirements
events.wd_description: To qualify for the tax credit, a certain percentage of the vehicle battery's critical minerals must be sourced from a US free trade agreement partner or recycled in North America.
events.description: To qualify for the tax credit, a certain percentage of the vehicle battery's critical minerals must be sourced from a US free trade agreement partner or recycled in North America.

events.name: t: starting percentage requirements
events.wd_description: Starting in 2023, 40% of the critical minerals in the vehicle battery must be sourced from a US free trade agreement partner or recycled in North America.
events.description: Starting in 2023, 40% of the critical minerals in the vehicle battery must be sourced from a US free trade agreement partner or recycled in North America.

events.name: t: increasing percentage requirements
events.wd_description: The required percentage of critical minerals will increase gradually to 80% by 2027.
events.description: The required percentage of critical minerals will increase gradually to 80% by 2027.

events.name: battery component requirements
events.wd_description: To qualify for the tax credit, a certain percentage of the vehicle battery's components must be manufactured or assembled in North America.
events.description: To qualify for the tax credit, a certain percentage of the vehicle battery's components must be manufactured or assembled in North America.

events.name: t: starting percentage requirements
events.wd_description: Starting in 2023, 50% of the battery components must be manufactured or assembled in North America.
events.description: Starting in 2023, 50% of the battery components must be manufactured or assembled in North America.

events.name: t: increasing percentage requirements
events.wd_description: The required percentage of battery components will increase gradually to 100% by 2029.
events.description: The required percentage of battery components will increase gradually to 100% by 2029.

events.name: exclusion of foreign entities
events.wd_description: The tax credit will be prohibited for vehicles with any critical minerals or components sourced from foreign entities of concern, such as China and Russia.
events.description: The tax credit will be prohibited for vehicles with any critical minerals or components sourced from foreign entities of concern, such as China and Russia.

events.name: t: exclusion of critical minerals
events.wd_description: Starting in 2024, vehicles with any critical minerals sourced from foreign entities of concern will be ineligible for the tax credit.
events.description: Starting in 2024, vehicles with any critical minerals sourced from foreign entities of concern will be ineligible for the tax credit.

events.name: t: exclusion of battery components
events.wd_description: Starting in 2023, vehicles with any battery components sourced from foreign entities of concern will be ineligible for the tax credit.
events.description: Starting in 2023, vehicles with any battery components sourced from foreign entities of concern will be ineligible for the tax credit.

events.name: tax credit for used clean vehicles
events.wd_label: tax credit for used clean vehicles
events.wd_description: The IRA establishes a tax credit for purchases of previously-owned clean vehicles, equivalent to 30% of the vehicle's sale price or $4,000, whichever is lower.
events.description: The IRA establishes a tax credit for purchases of previously-owned clean vehicles, equivalent to 30% of the vehicle's sale price or $4,000, whichever is lower.

events.name: outlook
events.wd_description: The IRA's passage is likely, with strong support from President Biden and Congressional Democrats, but it may prompt trade disputes and require substantial changes to sourcing practices within North America.
events.description: The IRA's passage is likely, with strong support from President Biden and Congressional Democrats, but it may prompt trade disputes and require substantial changes to sourcing practices within North America.

events.name: t: potential trade disputes
events.wd_description: The IRA may prompt trade disputes with countries such as Japan, South Korea, and the European Union due to its North American content and assembly requirements.
events.description: The IRA may prompt trade disputes with countries such as Japan, South Korea, and the European Union due to its North American content and assembly requirements.

events.name: t: changes to sourcing practices
events.wd_description: Even vehicle producers within North America will need to make substantial changes to their sourcing practices to comply with the IRA's requirements.
events.description: Even vehicle producers within North America will need to make substantial changes to their sourcing practices to comply with the IRA's requirements.
